news.details: two papers on hardware security and obfuscation, and adversarial machine learning accepted in DAC 2019
Arezou Koohi successfully defended her PhD dissertations
Jeremy Muldavin from DoD OSD visited ECE department and ASEEC lab
two papers on IoT security and malware detection accepted in DATE 2019
SMT attack accepted in CHES 2019 August, Maria Malik and Katayoun Neshatpour successfully defended their dissertations. Maria joined Intel, and Katayoun joined Cadence

A successful Planning Grant Meeting of NSF Center for Hardware and Embedded Systems Security and Trust (CHEST) @ GMU, 100+ participants from 6 member universities, more than 30 government research labs and lead industries in cybersecurity
Maria Malik received 2018 ECE Department Outstanding Academic Achievement Award
Member of Advisory Committee, Cybersecurity Research and Technology Commercialization (R&TC) working group, Commonwealth of Virginia
Special session on Adversarial Machine Learning at ICCAD 2018
